reasoning: Aortic regurgitation secondary to rheumatic fever/rheumatic heart disease. Reported incidence approximately 0.8 per 100k person-years in developed nations, with higher rates in developing regions. Prevalence ~4.5 per 100k reflects chronic nature. Geographic variation reflects RHD burden.
source: Carapetis JR et al. (2005). The global burden of group A streptococcal disease. Lancet Infect Dis. 5(11):685-694
